page.title: 01Penmanshiel Moor,Grantshouse
page.content: The general appearance of the area is predominated by Penmmanshiel moor,which lies 800 ft above sealevel. The moor itself extends 9m above settlement of Grantshouse and is relatively flat with high levels of soil water, making the ground very boggy. The semi natural vegetation on the moor, includes several types of mosses and heaths, which attract a variety of wildlife. The predominant feature of the area is the fine view across the eye valley to the Lamermuir hills due to its relatively high location and moorland vegetation, the predominant land uses are sheep grazing. The only farm within the area is Howpark, situated in the valley of Howpark Burn, where best land of the area is situated.
